Oleh sebab itu, orang-orang mukmin tidak boleh menyimpang dari ketentuan Allah, terutama mengenai larangan-Nya untuk memohonkan ampun bagi orang musyrik, walaupun ia termasuk kaum kerabat yang patut diurus dan ditolong. Demikian pula dalam ketentuan-ketentuan yang lain, baik berupa larangan, mupun perintah-perintah-Nya.
text.117:
Ayat ini merupakan lanjutan dari ayat-ayat terdahulu, mengenai masalah tobat dari orang-orang yang mangkir dari Perang Tabuk. Adalah menjadi suatu kebiasaan dalam Al-Qur'an untuk menghentikan suatu pembicaraan, lalu mengemukakan pembicaraan yang lain, tetapi kemudian kembali lagi membicarakan masalah semula. Cara semacam ini akan memberikan pengertian yang lebih mantap dan kesan kuat dalam hati dan pikiran orang-orang yang mendengar atau membacanya, dan tidak membosankan. Selain itu juga ada hubungan dengan larangan tentang memohonkan ampunan bagi orang-orang musyrik, yang tersebut dalam ayat yang lalu, karena dalam kedua masalah ini terdapat kesalahan yang perlu ditebus dengan jalan bertobat, dan memperbaiki kekeliruan yang perlu dimintakan ampunan dari Allah.

Dalam ayat ini, Allah menegaskan bahwa Dia telah menerima tobat Nabi Muhammad saw dan kaum Muhajirin serta Anshar dan orang-orang mukmin lainnya, yang telah mengikuti Nabi dalam masa-masa sulit, yaitu saat Perang Tabuk, karena Perang Tabuk itu terjadi dalam saat kesulitan. Kesulitan makanan, karena saat itu musim paceklik, sehingga sebutir kurma dimakan oleh satu atau dua orang. Kesulitan air, sehingga ada yang menyembelih untanya agar dapat mengambil air dari lambungnya untuk diminum, padahal unta itu amat mereka perlukan untuk pengangkutan dari satu tempat ke tempat yang lain, sehingga seekor unta dipakai untuk keperluan sepuluh orang. Ditambah lagi udara waktu itu (waktu terjadi Perang Tabuk) amat panas. Penerimaan tobat tersebut terjadi setelah hampir berpalingnya hati segolongan kaum Anshar dan Muhajirin tersebut, sehingga mereka pergi berperang dengan perasaan enggan dan berat, bahkan ada yang dengan sengaja mangkir dari peperangan. Tetapi kemudian Allah menerima tobat mereka setelah mereka menyadari kesalahan mereka.

Pada akhir ayat ini ditegaskan bahwa Allah Maha Pengasih dan Penyayang kepada Nabi dan para pengikutnya. Oleh sebab itu Dia senantiasa menerima tobat orang-orang yang benar-benar bertobat kepada-Nya.

Menurut penafsiran Ibnu 'Abbas, yang dimaksud Allah menerima tobat Nabi ialah tobat yang dilakukan Nabi atas kekeliruan beliau lantaran mengizinkan beberapa orang tidak ikut berperang, padahal mereka tidak mempunyai udzur yang dapat dibenarkan. Yang dimaksud dengan penerimaan tobat kaum Muhajirin dan Anshar ialah tobat yang mereka lakukan dari kesalahan mereka ketika mereka merasa keberatan untuk keluar ke medan perang, padahal mereka adalah orang-orang yang dipandang paling kuat imannya. Sebagian dari mereka mempunyai kesalahan lantaran mereka suka mendengarkan pembicaraan orang-orang munafik padahal pembicaraan itu dimaksudkan untuk menimbulkan fitnah di kalangan kaum Muslimin.
text.118:
Dalam ayat ini kembali diungkapkan hal ihwal tiga orang di antara orang-orang mukmin yang mangkir dari Perang Tabuk, yaitu: Ka'ab bin Malik, Hilal bin Umayyah, dan Murarah bin Rabi. Mereka ini semula dengan sengaja tidak ikut berperang bersama Rasulullah saw, tetapi kemudian mereka mengalami tekanan jiwa, dan dunia bagi mereka terasa sempit, karena orang-orang mukmin lainnya memandang mereka sebagai orang-orang yang tidak terhormat. Mereka merasa yakin, bahwa hanya Allah-lah tempat berlindung dari segala siksaan-Nya. Setelah datang kesadaran dan rasa penyesalan, maka mereka bertobat kepada Allah. Allah pun menerima tobat itu, agar mereka tetap berada dalam keinsafan kembali kepada agama Allah dengan bimbingan Rasul-Nya. Setelah terlanjur melakukan pelanggaran terhadap perintah-Nya.

Pada akhir ayat ini ditegaskan kembali bahwa Allah Maha Penerima Tobat serta Maha Pengasih kepada hamba-Nya. Dia senantiasa menerima tobat hamba-Nya yang benar-benar bertobat kepada-Nya dan mengampuni dosa serta melimpahkan rahmat dan nikmat-Nya kepada mereka, walaupun mereka itu telah terlanjur melakukan kesalahan yang menyebabkan mereka berhak untuk dijatuhi azab dan siksa.
text.119:
Allah menunjukkan seruan-Nya dan memberikan bimbingan kepada orang-orang yang beriman kepada-Nya dan Rasul-Nya, agar mereka tetap dalam ketakwaan serta mengharapkan rida-Nya, dengan cara menunaikan segala kewajiban yang telah ditetapkan-Nya, dan menjauhi segala larangan yang telah ditentukan-Nya, dan hendaklah senantiasa bersama orang-orang yang benar dan jujur, mengikuti ketakwaan, kebenaran dan kejujuran mereka. Dan jangan bergabung kepada kaum munafik, yang selalu menutupi kemunafikan mereka dengan kata-kata dan perbuatan bohong ditambah pula dengan sumpah palsu dan alasan-alasan yang tidak benar.

Al-Baihaqi meriwayatkan suatu hadis Rasulullah saw, bahwa beliau bersabda:

Sesungguhnya kejujuran itu menuntun kepada kebajikan, dan kebajikan itu menuntun kepada surga. Sesungguhnya seseorang akan berlaku jujur sampai ia ditulis di sisi Allah sebagai orang yang jujur. Dan sesungguhnya kedustaan itu menuntun kepada kejahatan, dan kejahatan itu menuntun ke neraka. Sesungguhnya seseorang itu berlaku dusta sehingga ia ditulis di sisi Allah sebagai pendusta. (Hadis Muttafaq 'Alaih)

Berdusta selamanya terlarang kecuali bila terpaksa, sebagai tipu muslihat dalam peperangan, atau untuk mendamaikan antara pihak-pihak yang ber-sengketa, atau kebohongan seorang lelaki kepada isterinya yang dimaksud-kan untuk menyenangkan hatinya, misalnya dalam memuji kecantikannya, akan tetapi bukan kebohongan dalam masalah keuangan dan kepentingan kehidupan rumah tangga atau lainnya. Dalam hal ini Rasulullah saw telah bersabda:

Setiap kebohongan yang dilakukan oleh seseorang selalu dituliskan sebagai dosanya kecuali bagi seorang yang berbohong sebagai tipu muslihat dalam peperangan, atau kebohongan untuk mendamaikan dua orang yang bersengketa atau kebohongan yang dilakukan seseorang terhadap isterinya dengan maksud untuk menyenangkan hatinya. (Riwayat Ibnu Abi Syaibah dan Ahmad, dari Asma binti Yazid)
text.120:
Allah menjelaskan bahwa kaum Muslimin yang berdiam di kota Medinah, dan kaum Muslimin Badui yang berdiam di sekitar kota Medinah seharusnya menyertai Rasulullah saw ke medan perang dan tidak patut bagi mereka untuk tidak mencintai Rasulullah saw karena lebih mencintai diri sendiri. Bila mereka tidak ikut ke medan perang dan hanya tinggal di rumah, ini berarti mereka tidak bersedia menanggung bermacam penderitaan untuk membela agama Allah, mereka tidak merasakan haus, payah dan lapar, dan tidak pula menginjak daerah yang dipertahankan oleh orang-orang kafir, dan tidak pula ikut menimpakan suatu bencana kepada musuh sebagai yang dirasakan dan dilaksanakan oleh orang-orang yang ikut berperang. Padahal jika mereka mengalami dan melaksanakan hal-hal tersebut niscaya akan dituliskan bagi mereka di sisi Allah sebagai amal saleh setiap kali mereka mengalami dan melaksanakannya, dan akan diberi ganjaran yang amat besar sebagaimana yang dilakukan terhadap orang-orang yang ikut berperang bersama Rasulullah. Setiap kebajikan yang dilakukan oleh orang-orang mukmin baik yang berupa pengorbanan lahir maupun batin tidak akan disia-siakan Allah, apalagi kebajikan untuk membela agama-Nya.

Orang-orang yang tinggal di rumah tanpa alasan yang dibenarkan Allah, sesungguhnya adalah orang-orang yang mementingkan diri sendiri, tidak bersedia memberikan pengorbanan dan penderitaan untuk kepentingan bersama dan untuk membela agama Allah. Padahal kenikmatan yang mereka peroleh dalam rumah tangga mereka adalah semata-mata karunia dan rahmat dari Allah.

Kesetiaan dan ketaatan kepada Rasulullah haruslah dalam segala situasi dan keadaan, baik pada waktu suka, maupun duka, yang memerlukan pengorbanan atas kesenangan diri, kenikmatan hidup, harta benda dan jiwa raga. Oleh sebab itu, bila datang suatu bahaya yang mengancam kepentingan bersama, kehormatan bangsa dan agama, maka setiap orang mukmin harus bangkit berjuang bersama-sama, tanpa memperhitungkan laba-rugi bagi diri sendiri. Ini adalah lebih mulia, dari pada yang hidup dalam kemewahan, tetapi kehilangan kehormatan diri, agama, bangsa, dan tanah airnya.

Allah tidak menyia-nyiakan setiap amal kebajikan dan pengorbanan yang diberikan oleh setiap orang mukmin. Ganjaran pahala yang amat besar disediakan-Nya untuk orang-orang mukmin yang telah berjuang bersama Rasulullah, dan selanjutnya, untuk orang-orang mukmin yang berjuang di jalan Allah, hingga Hari Kiamat kelak. Balasan setiap kebajikan adalah kebajikan pula, inilah ketentuan dari Allah.
text.121:
Allah menjelaskan bahwa mereka yang tinggal di rumah dan tidak berangkat ke medan perang bersama Rasulullah, tentu tidak ikut memberikan sumbangan bagi perjuangan dan mereka tidak ikut merasakan kepayahan melintasi lembah dan padang pasir. Lain halnya dengan orang-orng yang ikut berperang. Mereka yang berbuat dan mengalami hal yang demikian itu niscaya dituliskan di sisi Allah sebagai amal saleh, karena Allah akan memberikan kepada mereka balasan yang jauh lebih tinggi nilainya daripada apa yang telah mereka sumbangkan dan apa yang mereka perbuat itu.

Orang-orang yang ikut berperang serta menyumbangkan harta bendanya untuk perjuangan di jalan Allah, berarti telah melakukan dua macam pengorbanan yang mulia, yaitu pengorbanan harta benda, dan pengorbanan jiwa raga. Pengorbanan yang paling mulia, tentulah berhak untuk diberi ganjaran yang paling mulia pula, bahkan ganjaran itu lebih tinggi dari pada pengorbanan yang telah diberikannya. Mengenai hal ini, telah ada suatu ketentuan dalam agama Islam, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Barang siapa berbuat kebaikan mendapat balasan sepuluh kali lipat amalnya. (al-An'am/6: 160)

Perlu diingat bahwa pahala yang besar itu tidak hanya diberikan Allah kepada orang mukmin yang mengorbankan harta benda dan jiwa raga dalam peperangan saja, melainkan juga kepada orang-orang mukmin yang melakukan amal kebajikan dalam bidang yang lain. Namun demikian, pengorbanan yang diberikan dalam berjihad di medan perang untuk membela agama adalah lebih mulia daripada pengorbanan untuk kepentingan yang lain. Sehingga pengorbanan harta yang sedikit jumlahnya untuk keperluan jihad sama nilainya dengan pengorbanan harta yang banyak untuk kebajikan yang lain. Penderitaan yang sedikit yang diderita dalam berjihad sama nilainya dengan penderitaan besar yang dialami dalam perbuatan amal yang lain.
text.122:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa tidak semua orang mukmin harus berangkat ke medan perang, bila peperangan itu dapat dilakukan oleh sebagian kaum Muslimin saja. Tetapi harus ada pembagian tugas dalam masyarakat, sebagian berangkat ke medan perang, dan sebagian lagi harus menuntut ilmu dan mendalami agama Islam, supaya ajaran-ajaran agama itu dapat diajarkan secara merata, dan dakwah dapat dilakukan dengan cara yang lebih efektif dan bermanfaat sehingga kecerdasan umat Islam dapat ditingkatkan.

Perang bertujuan untuk mengalahkan musuh-musuh Islam serta mengamankan jalan dakwah Islamiyah. Sedang menuntut ilmu dan mendalami ilmu-ilmu agama bertujuan untuk mencerdaskan umat dan mengembangkan agama Islam, agar dapat disebarluaskan dan dipahami oleh semua macam lapisan masyarakat.

Dengan demikian, ayat ini mempunyai hubungan yang erat dengan ayat-ayat yang lalu, karena sama-sama menerangkan hukum berjihad, akan tetapi dalam bidang dan cara yang berlainan. 

Tugas ulama dalam Islam adalah untuk mempelajari agamanya, serta mengamalkannya dengan baik, kemudian menyampaikan pengetahuan agama itu kepada yang belum mengetahuinya. Tugas-tugas tersebut merupakan tugas umat dan setiap pribadi muslim, sesuai dengan kemampuan dan pengetahuan masing-masing, karena Rasulullah saw telah bersabda:

Sampaikanlah olehmu (apa-apa yang telah kamu peroleh) dari padaku, walaupun hanya satu ayat Al-Qur'an saja. (Riwayat al-Bukhari)

Akan tetapi, tidak setiap orang Islam mendapat kesempatan untuk menuntut dan mendalami ilmu pengetahuan serta mendalami ilmu agama, karena sibuk dengan tugas di medan perang, di ladang, di pabrik, di toko dan sebagainya. Oleh sebab itu harus ada sebagian dari umat Islam yang menggunakan waktu dan tenaganya untuk menuntut ilmu dan mendalami ilmu-ilmu agama, agar kemudian setelah mereka selesai dan kembali ke masyarakat, mereka dapat menyebarkan ilmu tersebut, serta menjalankan dakwah Islamiyah dengan cara dan metode yang baik sehingga mencapai hasil yang lebih baik pula.

Apabila umat Islam telah memahami ajaran agamanya, dan telah mengerti hukum halal dan haram, serta perintah dan larangan agama, tentulah mereka akan lebih dapat menjaga diri dari kesesatan dan kemaksiatan, dapat melaksanakan perintah agama dengan baik dan dapat menjauhi larangan-Nya. Dengan demikian, umat Islam menjadi umat yang baik, sejahtera dunia dan akhirat.

Di samping itu perlu diingat, bahwa apabila umat Islam menghadapi peperangan yang memerlukan tenaga manusia yang banyak, maka dalam hal ini seluruh umat Islam harus dikerahkan untuk menghadapi musuh. Tetapi bila peperangan itu sudah selesai, maka masing-masing harus kembali kepada tugas semula, kecuali sejumlah orang yang diberi tugas khusus untuk menjaga keamanan dan ketertiban, dalam dinas kemiliteran dan kepolisian.

Oleh karena ayat ini telah menetapkan bahwa fungsi ilmu adalah untuk mencerdaskan umat, maka tidak dapat dibenarkan bila ada orang Islam yang menuntut ilmu pengetahuan hanya untuk mengejar pangkat dan kedudukan atau keuntungan pribadi saja, apalagi untuk menggunakan ilmu pengetahuan sebagai kebanggaan dan kesombongan diri terhadap golongan yang belum menerima pengetahuan.

Orang-orang yang telah memiliki ilmu pengetahuan harus menjadi pelita dan pembimbing bagi umatnya. Ia harus menyebarluaskan ilmunya, dan membimbing orang lain agar memiliki ilmu pengetahuan pula. Selain itu, ia sendiri juga harus mengamalkan ilmunya agar menjadi contoh dan teladan bagi orang-orang sekitarnya dalam ketaatan menjalankan peraturan dan ajaran-ajaran agama.

Dengan demikian dapat diambil suatu pengertian, bahwa dalam bidang ilmu pengetahuan, setiap orang mukmin mempunyai tiga macam kewajiban, yaitu: menuntut ilmu, mengamalkannya, dan mengajarkannya kepada orang lain.

Menurut pengertian yang tersurat dari ayat ini, kewajiban menuntut ilmu pengetahuan yang ditekankan di sisi Allah adalah dalam bidang ilmu agama. Akan tetapi agama adalah suatu sistem hidup yang mencakup seluruh aspek dan segi kehidupan manusia. Setiap ilmu pengetahuan yang berguna dan dapat mencerdaskan kehidupan mereka, dan tidak bertentangan dengan norma-norma agama, wajib dipelajari. Umat Islam diperintahkan Allah untuk memakmurkan bumi ini dan menciptakan kehidupan yang baik. Sedang ilmu pengetahuan adalah sarana untuk mencapai tujuan tersebut. Setiap sarana yang diperlukan untuk melaksanakan kewajiban, adalah wajib pula hukumnya. Dalam hal ini, para ulama Islam telah menetapkan suatu kaidah yang berbunyi:

Sesuatu yang diperlukan untuk melaksanakan yang wajib, maka ia wajib pula hukumnya.

Karena pentingnya fungsi ilmu dan para sarjana, maka beberapa negara Islam membebaskan para ulama (sarjana) dan mahasiswa pada perguruan agama, dari wajib militer, agar pengajaran dan pengembangan ilmu senantiasa dapat berjalan dengan lancar, kecuali bila negara sedang menghadapi bahaya besar, yang harus dihadapi oleh segala lapisan masyarakat.
text.123:
Pedoman dan petunjuk berperang yang ditunjukkan Allah dalam ayat ini kepada Rasulullah saw dan kaum Muslimin adalah lebih dahulu memerangi musuh-musuh Islam yang berada pada garis lingkaran yang terdekat dengan pusat kedudukan umat Islam, kemudian dilanjutkan kepada lingkaran yang lebih jauh.

Hal ini didasarkan kepada prinsip, bahwa peperangan yang dilakukan umat Islam hanyalah untuk mengamankan jalannya dakwah Islamiyah dan untuk melindungi keselamatan umat Islam, sedang dakwah tersebut juga dimulai dari orang-orang yang terdekat, dilanjutkan kepada orang-orang yang lebih jauh. Dengan demikian, terlihat adanya keselarasan antara dakwah Islamiyah dan peperangan tersebut.

Petunjuk ini telah dilaksanakan dengan baik oleh Rasulullah saw, baik dalam bidang dakwah, maupun peperangan yang berfungsi untuk meng-amankan dakwah tersebut. Mengenai dakwah, beliau telah melaksanakannya lebih dahulu kepada keluarganya yang terdekat dan sahabat-sahabat karibnya, sesuai dengan petunjuk Allah.

Dan berilah peringatan kepada kerabat-kerabatmu yang terdekat. (asy-Syu'ara/26: 214)

Dan firman-Nya dalam ayat yang lain:

¦dan agar kamu memberi peringatan kepada (penduduk) Ummul Qura (Mekah) dan orang-orang yang di luar lingkungannya. (al-An'am/6: 92)

Kemudian, dakwah ini beliau lanjutkan kepada masyarakat yang lebih luas, tidak saja dalam lingkungan negeri Arab, bahkan kepada raja-raja dan bangsa-bangsa sekitar Jazirah Arab.

Demikian pula dalam hal peperangan, sesuai dengan ayat-ayat sebelum-nya dimulai dari musuh-musuh Islam yang terdekat, yang selalu melakukan tipu daya untuk menghalang-halangi kelangsungan dakwah Islamiyah. Kemudian dilanjutkan kepada suku-suku Arab yang lebih jauh dari pusat kedudukan atau basis umat Islam. Sesudah Rasulullah saw wafat, maka para khalifah sesudahnya meneruskan peperangan tersebut ke daerah-daerah yang lebih jauh, yaitu ke negeri Syam (Syria) dan Irak. Kemudian menyusup ke benua Afrika (sebelah Barat) dan Persia, Khurasan, bahkan sampai ke pegunungan Hindukust (sebelah Timur) sesuai dengan perluasan dakwah Islamiyah.

Musuh-musuh Islam yang terdekat kepada Rasulullah dan kaum Muslimin ketika itu ialah orang-orang kafir yang terdiri dari kaum Yahudi yang berdiam di kota Medinah, kemudian di Khaibar, dan selanjutnya mereka yang memerangi kaum Muslimin di Perang Tabuk, dan sesudah itu musuh-musuh Islam di daerah-daerah Syam yang ketika itu berada dalam kekuasaan Romawi Timur yang berpusat di Bizantium.

Strategi perang dengan cara memulai dari yang terdekat kepada yang jauh, adalah tepat sekali, ditinjau dari berbagai segi, yaitu: dari segi kemungkinan fasilitas pengangkutan, perbekalan, dan biaya. Semakin dekat tempatnya, semakin mudah cara-cara pengangkutan, dan dengan demikian semakin kecil pula biaya dan perbekalan yang diperlukan. Semakin jauh tempat yang harus didatangi, semakin sukar pula pengangkutan, dan semakin banyak pula waktu dan perbekalan yang diperlukan. Dengan sendirinya semakin banyak biaya dan tenaga yang dibutuhkan.

Perang dalam tuntunan ajaran Islam adalah perjuangan yang harus dipersiapkan untuk terciptanya perdamaian sebagaimana pepatah dalam bahasa Arab, yang diungkapkan dalam kalimat:

Perdamaian yang dipersenjatai

Dalam kaidah umum biasa dikatakan, kita harus selalu siap berperang untuk menciptakan perdamaian. Jika kita tidak dalam keadaan siap perang maka musuh setiap saat dapat menyerang kita, tetapi jika kita dalam keadaan siap perang maka musuhpun tidak berani menyerang kita.

Karena itulah dalam Al-Qur'an, terutama Surah at-Taubah banyak mengungkapkan persoalan perang dan petunjuk-petunjuk kepada umat Islam untuk selalu siap berperang dengan berbagai stretegi untuk mewujudkan perdamaian.

Allah memberikan petunjuk-Nya, agar kaum Muslimin mampu meng-gunakan kekerasan dan kekuatan terhadap orang-orang kafir yang menghalang-halangi dakwah Islamiyah, apabila jalan diplomasi dan perlakuan yang lemah lembut dan ramah tamah tidak bermanfaat lagi untuk mereka. Kaum Muslimin diperintahkan untuk bersikap adil, kasih sayang, dan ramah tamah kepada orang-orang bukan Islam. Akan tetapi bila mereka tetap mengganggu kepentingan umat Islam, terutama dakwah Islamiyah, maka kaum Muslimin harus menggunakan kekuatan dan kekuasaan, sehingga mereka menghentikan permusuhan terhadap Islam dan kaum Muslimin. Hal ini tersebut pula dalam firman Allah pada ayat yang lain:

Hai Nabi, berjihadlah (melawan) orang-orang kafir dan orang-orang munafik itu, dan bersikap keraslah terhadap mereka. (at-Taubah/9: 73)

Dengan demikian jelaslah bahwa kaum Muslimin harus siap mengguna-kan dua macam sikap dalam menghadapi orang kafir dan munafik yaitu, pertama sikap diplomasi yang luwes, lembut, dan ramah tamah jika mereka mau diajak berdamai. Orang kafir dalam hubungan ini disebut sebagai kafir mu'ahidi atau kafir zimmi, jika mereka termasuk warga negara kita. Kedua, tegas dan bila perlu mempergunakan kekuatan, apabila mereka tidak mau diajak hidup berdampingan secara damai. Orang kafir dalam kondisi demikian disebut sebagai kafir harbi, sehingga tidak ada jalan menghadapi mereka kecuali dengan kekuatan dan peperangan.

Pada akhir ayat ini Allah meyakinkan orang-orang yang bertakwa, bahwa Dia senantiasa bersama mereka. Artinya Allah memberikan jaminan kepada orang-orang yang bertakwa, yaitu yang senantiasa menjaga hukum-hukum dan ketentuan Allah, bahwa Dia akan selalu memberikan bantuan dan pertolongan-Nya. Ketentuan-ketentuan Allah yang perlu diperhatikan dalam masalah peperangan ialah agar umat Islam tidak lalai dalam mempersiapkan segala sesuatu yang perlu untuk mencapai kemenangan, yaitu kekuatan fisik dan mental. Kekuatan fisik mencakup: prajurit yang berbadan sehat dan kuat, alat-alat senjata yang efektif, kubu-kubu pertahanan yang tangguh, serta perbekalan dan perlengkapan yang cukup. Sedang kekuatan mental ialah: niat yang ikhlas, semangat yang tinggi, kesabaran dan keuletan yang tangguh, serta siasat perang yang jitu serta disiplin yang kuat, dan persatuan yang kokoh. Termasuk pula etika perang dan moral yang tinggi, yaitu tidak berlaku zalim terhadap wanita, anak-anak, orang tua yang lemah, serta tidak pula berlaku kejam terhadap orang-orang yang sudah menyerah atau tertawan, selama mereka ini tidak membahayakan bagi kepentingan Islam dan umat Islam. Untuk mencapai kemenangan ini diperlukan iman yang kokoh, serta ingat dan tawakkal kepada Allah.
text.124:
Sikap kaum munafik di masa Nabi Muhammad saw di antaranya adalah apabila ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an diturunkan kepada beliau dan disampaikan kepada mereka, maka di antara mereka itu ada yang bertanya kepada teman-temannya baik dari kalangan munafik sendiri maupun teman-teman mereka dari kaum Muslimin yang lemah imannya bahwa siapakah di antara mereka yang bertambah imannya dengan turunnya surah ini. Ini meyakinkan bahwa Al-Qur'an ini benar-benar dari Allah bahwa Muhammad itu benar-benar pesuruh Allah, bahwa tiap-tiap ayat Al-Qur'an merupakan mukjizat bagi Muhammad, dan bahwa Al-Qur'an itu bukan buatan Muhammad.

Jika diperhatikan pertanyaan orang munafik yang tersebut dalam ayat-ayat ini, dirasakan bahwa pertanyaan itu bukanlah maksudnya untuk menanyakan sesuatu yang tidak diketahui, tetapi menunjukkan apa yang menjadi isi hati mereka; yaitu mereka belum percaya kepada Rasulullah, sekalipun mulut mereka telah mengakuinya. Bahkan mereka ingin agar orang-orang Islam yang lemah imannya menjadi seperti mereka pula. Seandainya tidak ada penyakit di dalam hati orang-orang munafik itu, pasti mereka mengetahui bahwa iman yang sesungguhnya yang disertai dengan ketundukan dan penghambaan diri kepada Allah, karena telah merasakan dan meyakini kekuasaan-Nya, pasti akan bertambah dengan mendengar dan membaca ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an, apalagi jika langsung mendengarnya dari Rasulullah saw sendiri.

Sifat-sifat munafik ini diterangkan dalam firman-Nya:

Mereka menipu Allah dan orang-orang yang beriman, padahal mereka hanyalah menipu diri sendiri tanpa mereka sadari. Dalam hati mereka ada penyakit, lalu Allah menambah penyakitnya itu; dan mereka mendapat azab yang pedih, karena mereka berdusta. (al-Baqarah/2: 9-10)

Mengenai kesan terhadap ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an dalam hati orang-orang yang beriman diterangkan dalam firman Allah:

Sebenarnya, (Al-Qur'an) itu adalah ayat-ayat yang jelas di dalam dada orang-orang yang berilmu. Hanya orang-orang yang zalim yang mengingkari ayat-ayat Kami. (al-'Ankabut/29: 49)

Pertanyaan orang-orang munafik itu dijawab Allah dengan ungkapan yang tersebut pada akhir ayat ini yang maksudnya adalah orang-orang yang beriman, maka surah ini menambah imannya dan mereka merasa gembira.
text.125: Jawaban pertanyaan mereka seputar Al-Qur'an diterangkan pada ayat ini. Adapun orang-orang yang hatinya ragu-ragu dan orang-orang munafik, yaitu orang-orang yang hatinya penuh kekafiran sedang mulutnya menyatakan iman, setiap ayat yang disampaikan kepada mereka selalu menimbulkan keragu-raguan dan kemunafikan dalam hati mereka. Hal seperti ini selalu bertambah kuat pengaruhnya pada diri mereka, sehingga akhirnya mereka mati sebagai seorang munafik yang kafir. Hal yang mereka alami ini akan dialami oleh orang-orang sesudah mereka, yang sama hatinya dengan hati mereka, mereka akan mati sebagai orang kafir.
text.126: Pada ayat ini Allah tidak membenarkan bahkan mencela sikap orang-orang munafik yang tetap membangkang, tidak mau bertobat dan tidak pula mengambil pelajaran dari berbagai peristiwa yang telah mereka alami. Padahal kepada mereka setiap tahun telah didatangkan cobaan dan pengalaman pahit serta kekalahan yang seharusnya dapat menambah kuat iman seseorang sehingga mampu membedakan antara yang benar dan yang salah. Berbagai cobaan, ujian, dan pengalaman mereka itu, jika mereka mau merenungkannya dengan baik, tentu akan menyampaikan mereka kepada kesimpulan bahwa Muhammad itu benar-benar Rasulullah yang diutus Allah kepada mereka. Akan tetapi, mereka tetap ingkar dan tidak mau bertobat serta mengambil pelajaran dari padanya. Bahkan hati mereka bertambah sesat dan bertambah ingkar.
text.127:
Ayat ini menerangkan sikap dan tindakan orang-orang munafik di majlis Rasulullah waktu diturunkan ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an. Bila diturunkan satu ayat atau satu surah kepada Rasulullah saw, mereka saling berpandangan satu sama lain dan mengedipkan mata sebagai isyarat memandang enteng apa yang telah diturunkan itu. Sikap mereka ini menunjukkan bahwa pengaruh kekafiran telah berurat berakar dalam jiwa mereka. Mereka sebenarnya tidak ingin mendengarkan ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an dari Rasulullah, dan tidak ingin orang lain mendapat petunjuk dari Al-Qur'an.

Sikap orang-orang munafik lainnya ialah: mereka secara diam-diam meninggalkan majlis Rasulullah saw seraya saling bertanya kepada sesama temannya yang lain, "Apakah ada orang yang melihat kepergian kita meninggalkan majlis itu?" Sedangkan orang-orang mukmin mendengar dan memperhatikan ayat-ayat itu dengan tunduk dan penuh perhatian.

Sikap orang-orang munafik inilah yang membuat Allah memalingkan hati mereka dari iman dan dari petunjuk-petunjuk yang ada dalam ayat-ayat Al-Qur'an. Allah melakukan yang demikian karena mereka lebih dulu mengingkari seruan Nabi dan tidak menghiraukan petunjuk-petunjuk Al-Qur'an.
text.128:
Ayat ini sekalipun khusus ditujukan kepada bangsa Arab di masa Nabi, tetapi juga ditujukan kepada seluruh umat manusia. Semula ditujukan kepada orang Arab di masa Nabi, karena kepada merekalah Al-Qur'an pertama kali disampaikan, karena Al-Qur'an itu dalam bahasa Arab, tentulah orang Arab yang paling dapat memahami dan merasakan ketinggian sastra Al-Qur'an. Dengan demikian mereka mudah pula menyampaikan kepada orang-orang selain bangsa Arab. Jika orang-orang Arab sendiri tidak mempercayai Muhammad dan Al-Qur'an, tentu orang-orang selain Arab lebih sukar mempercayainya.

Ayat ini seakan-akan mengingatkan orang-orang Arab, sebagaimana isinya yang berbunyi, "Hai orang-orang Arab, telah diutus seorang Rasul dari bangsamu sendiri yang kamu ketahui sepenuhnya asal-usul dan kepribadian-nya, serta kamu lebih mengetahuinya dari orang-orang lain."

Sebagian mufassir menafsirkan perkataan "Rasulun min anfusikum" dengan hadis:

Bersabda Rasulullah saw, "Sesungguhnya Allah telah memilih Bani Kinanah dari keturunan Ismail, dan memilih suku Quraisy dari Bani Kinanah, dan memilih Bani Hasyim dari suku Quraisy, dan Allah telah memilihku dari Bani Hasyim." (Riwayat Muslim dan at-Tirmidzi dari Wasilah bin Asqa)

Dari ayat dan hadis di atas dapat dipahami tentang kesucian keturunan Nabi Muhammad saw, yang berasal dari suku-suku pilihan dari bangsa Arab. Dan orang-orang Arab mengetahui benar tentang hal ini.

Nabi Muhammad saw yang berasal dari keturunan yang baik dan terhormat mempunyai sifat-sifat yang mulia dan agung, yaitu:

1. Nabi merasa tidak senang jika umatnya ditimpa sesuatu yang tidak diinginkan, seperti dihinakan karena dijajah dan diperhamba oleh musuh-musuh kaum Muslimin, sebagaimana ia tidak senang pula melihat umatnya ditimpa azab yang pedih di akhirat nanti.

2. Nabi sangat menginginkan agar umatnya mendapat taufik dari Allah, bertambah kuat imannya, dan bertambah baik keadaannya. Keinginan beliau ini dilukiskan oleh Allah dalam firman-Nya:

Jika engkau (Muhammad) sangat mengharapkan agar mereka mendapat petunjuk, maka sesungguhnya Allah tidak akan memberi petunjuk kepada orang yang disesatkan-Nya, dan mereka tidak mempunyai penolong. (an-Nahl/16: 37)

Dan Allah berfirman:

Dan kebanyakan manusia tidak akan beriman walaupun engkau sangat menginginkannya. (Yusuf/12: 103)

3. Nabi selalu belas kasihan dan amat penyayang kepada kaum Muslimin. Keinginannya ini tampak pada tujuan risalah yang disampaikannya, yaitu agar manusia hidup berbahagia di dunia dan akhirat nanti.

Dalam ayat ini Allah memberikan dua macam sifat kepada Nabi Muhammad, kedua sifat itu juga merupakan sifat Allah sendiri, yang termasuk di antara "asmaul husna", yaitu sifat "rauf" (amat belas kasihan) dan sifat "rahim" (penyayang) sebagai tersebut dalam firman-Nya:

...Sungguh, Allah Maha Pengasih, Maha Penyayang kepada manusia. (al-Baqarah/2: 143)

Pemberian kedua sifat itu kepada Muhammad menunjukkan bahwa Allah menjadikan Muhammad sebagai Rasul yang dimuliakan-Nya.
text.129:
Ayat ini memerintahkan kepada Nabi Muhammad dan umatnya bahwa jika orang-orang kafir dan munafik itu tidak juga mau beriman setelah didatangkan kepada mereka petunjuk, katakanlah kepada mereka, "Cukuplah Allah bagiku, dan Dia akan menolongku, tidak ada Tuhan yang lain yang disembah, selain Dia, hanya kepada-Nya-lah aku bertawakal dan menyerahkan diri, dan hanya Dialah yang mengatur dan mengurus alam semesta, Dia memiliki 'Arsy yang Agung."

Diriwayatkan dari Zaid bin sabit yang ditugaskan oleh 'Umar ra untuk mengumpulkan Al-Qur'an yang masih belum terkumpul di masa Abu Bakar, bahwa Zaid berkata, "...Hingga aku memperoleh dua ayat terakhir dari Surah at-Taubah pada catatan Khuzaimah bin sabit al-Anshari, aku tidak memperolehnya sebelumnya dari seorang pun, sedang kedua ayat itu dihafal dan dikenal oleh orang banyak." (Riwayat al-Bukhari, at-Tirmidzi, an-Nasa'i dan perawi-perawi yang lain).

text.1:
Many fundamental issues explained in Surah al-Anfal are also explained in this surah with a broader and deeper expression, sometimes in more detail, so that this surah in some respects adds to the perfection of Surah al-Anfal. Allah sent the Prophet Muhammad saw to this world as the last messenger to develop the religion of Islam with da'wah based on arguments that can convince its truth, without coercion based on the power of weapons and wealth. However, the polytheists continued to oppose him in every way, from words to deeds that were beyond the limits of humanity, so that many Muslims were forced to migrate to the land of Habasyah (Ethiopia) and other places. Because the Prophet Muhammad saw and some of his companions still remained in Mecca to continue the da'wah, the Quraysh polytheists held a meeting in a place called "Darun Nadwah" to make a decision whether Muhammad should be killed or exiled. Finally, they decided that Muhammad should be killed. In this critical situation, Allah ordered the Prophet Muhammad saw to migrate to Medina, which was then followed by his companions who were able to come to Medina. In Medina, the Prophet and his companions who migrated were greeted by the Muslim residents with extraordinary welcome, as Allah explained in His word:

And they give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. (al-hasyr/59: 9)

Furthermore, the Prophet saw made a peace and mutual assistance agreement with the Jews, but they betrayed and violated the agreement by helping the polytheists who always opposed the Prophet in Mecca. So that the hostility from the polytheists increased, even they intended to destroy the religion of Islam, so war was prescribed in Islam. Then the Prophet made a peace agreement with the polytheists in Hudaibiyah for a period of ten years with very lenient conditions, which seemed to benefit the polytheists, but the polytheists violated the agreement, so there was no other choice for the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims, other than to face the challenge with full faith and courage. Finally, in the 8th year of Hijri, the city of Mecca was conquered by the Muslims. Thus the strength of the polytheists became weak, but they still resisted in every way they could, so this surah was revealed which declared the cancellation of the peace treaty and the severance of relations with the polytheists.

This verse declares the cancellation of various peace treaties with the polytheists in a more firm and positive way than what Allah has explained in His word:

And if you [O Muhammad] fear treachery from a people, throw [their treaty] back to them in a fair way. Indeed, Allah does not like the treacherous. (al-Anfal/8: 58)

Many opinions of the scholars of tafsir about the treaty that was canceled in this verse. According to Ibn Jarir and Ibn Kathir, the best and strongest opinion is that the treaty is the one with a specified time, while the treaty that is still valid must be waited until its time expires, in accordance with the fourth verse of this surah which will be explained later.
text.2:
In this verse, Allah explains that Muslims should give the polytheists, who always betray their promises, the opportunity to walk the earth for four months freely and safely without being disturbed by anyone, so that they can think more calmly to determine their attitude, whether they want to embrace Islam or continue to oppose the Muslims.

As for the start of the four-month period, according to the well-known opinion, it is from the 10th of Zulhijjah in the 9th year of Hijri to the 10th of Rabiul Akhir in the 10th year of Hijri. This is in accordance with what was narrated by Abu Masyar al-Madani from Muhammad bin Ka'ab al-Qurazi and others, which means: The Messenger of Allah (saw) sent Abu Bakr as Amir Haji in the 9th year of Hijri and also sent Ali bin Abi Thalib carrying 30 or 40 verses of Bara'ah to be read to the people in Mina.

Another opinion states that, to avoid confusion, a distinction needs to be made between the four months mentioned here and the four months in which fighting is generally prohibited, as mentioned in the sahih hadith which reads:

"Verily, time has come back to its original state as it was on the day when Allah created the heavens and the earth; the year is twelve months, four of which are sacred, three are in succession; Dhul-Qa'dah, Dhul-Hijjah and Muharram, and Rajab of Mudar which comes between Jumadi (al-Akhir) and Sha'ban." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Bakhirah)

The four months in this hadith are also what is meant in Surah al-Baqarah/2: 217, al-Maidah/5: 2, and others, where fighting is generally prohibited. Furthermore, in this verse, Allah explains that if the polytheists still oppose and antagonize Allah and His Messenger, then they must understand that they will not be able to weaken Allah, but they themselves will bear all the consequences. This is a *sunnatullah* (Allah's established way) that applies to the disbelievers, as explained in Allah's words:

"Those before them denied (the messengers), so the punishment came upon them from where they did not perceive. So Allah made them taste disgrace in worldly life. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew." (Az-Zumar/39: 25-26)
text.3:
In this verse, Allah explains a declaration on the Day of the Greater Pilgrimage (Haji Akbar) which states that Allah and His Messenger sever ties and agreements with the polytheists and cleanse their religion of all superstitions and errors.

Many authentic hadiths are narrated concerning this matter, including Abu Hurairah's saying:

I (Abu Hurairah) was sent by Abu Bakr on the day of Eid al-Adha along with people assigned to proclaim in Mina that polytheists are not allowed to perform Hajj after this year and are not allowed to circumambulate the Kaaba naked. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) followed up by sending Ali bin Abi Talib and commanding him to proclaim (recite the verse of) Bara'ah and that polytheists are not allowed to perform Hajj after that year and are not allowed to circumambulate the Kaaba naked (as was the custom of the polytheists). (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah)

Abu Hurairah also said:

I was with Ali bin Abi Talib when he was sent by the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) to the people of Mecca with (reciting) the verse of Bara'ah, then he asked, "What are you proclaiming (announcing)?" Ali replied, "We are proclaiming that no one will enter Paradise except believers, it is not permissible to circumambulate the Kaaba naked, whoever has a treaty with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), then its term or duration is up to four months, and when four months are completed, then Allah and His Messenger are free from the polytheists, and it is not permissible for polytheists to perform Hajj to this Kaaba after this year (the 9th year of Hijri)." (Narrated by Ahmad from Abu Hurairah)

Scholars have put forward many opinions about what is meant by Haji Akbar, including the following:

a. According to Abdullah bin Harits, Ibn Sirin, and Asy-Syafii, what is meant by Haji Akbar is the Day of Arafah, based on the hadith narrated by Ahmad, Abu Daud, at-Tirmidzi, an-Nasa'i, and Ibn Majah.

b. According to Ibn Qayyim and others, what is meant by Haji Akbar is the Day of Nahr or the day of sacrificing the animal (10th of Zulhijjah) based on the hadith narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim.

c. Al-Qadzi (Iyadz) said, "If we examine these opinions, then the chosen opinion is that Haji Akbar is the days of performing the rituals of Hajj as stated by Mujahid. But if we discuss the day of Eid al-Adha, then without a doubt it is standing in Arafah because Hajj is Arafah. Whoever can stand in Arafah, then he has truly performed Hajj, and whoever does not stand in Arafah, then he does not obtain Hajj. So what is meant by Haji Akbar in this surah and spoken by the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) in his sermon, is the Day of Nahr."

As for why it is called Haji Akbar, which means the Greater Pilgrimage, some scholars say it is to distinguish it from Umrah, which is called the Lesser Pilgrimage. Some also say it is because the deeds performed during the Hajj period have a greater reward compared to the deeds performed at other times. Some also say it is because at that time a greater glory appears for the Muslims and humiliation for the polytheists, and there are many other different opinions.

According to this verse, the continuation of that notification is that if the polytheists repent, regret their errors from the act of shirk, violating promises, and so on, and return to the right path, which is to believe in Allah and His Messenger and eliminate hostility with the Muslims, then that is best for them for the happiness of this world and the hereafter. However, if they turn away, do not want to accept the truth and guidance, and remain defiant, then they will not be able to weaken Allah's power and will not be able to eliminate the help that Allah promised to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) and to the believers, namely their victory in defeating the polytheists and hypocrites. Not only will they suffer defeat and humiliation in this world, but the Messenger of Allah is also commanded by Allah to convey the news that they will receive a very painful punishment in the hereafter.
text.4:
In this verse, Allah explains that the time given to the Muslims to the polytheists to determine their stance should not exceed four months, except for those who have made agreements with the Muslims, and those who have not reduced the contents of the agreement and have not helped those who are hostile to the Muslims. For them, the agreement must be maintained and perfected according to its contents until its expiration date. Ibn Abi Hatim narrated that the Prophet perfected his agreement with the tribes of Bani Amrah and Bani Kinanah.

These verses and other verses show that every agreement that is still valid must be fulfilled and perfected according to the conditions of the agreement, even if the agreement is with the polytheists, as long as they still fulfill all the conditions of the agreement.

The end of this verse explains that Allah SWT loves those who are pious (muttaqin). This indicates that maintaining and perfecting promises is included in piety (taqwa). Because maintaining an agreement means maintaining accountability for justice between people, which brings happiness in life in this world and the hereafter.
text.5:
When the months during which it was forbidden to fight the polytheists of Mecca had ended, namely the four months counted from the 10th of Zulhijjah to the 10th of Rabiul Akhir in the 9th year of Hijriah, the Muslims were commanded to do one of four things that would be more beneficial to them, namely:

1.  Fight the polytheists wherever they are, both in the holy land and outside of it.

2.  Take them captive.

3.  Besiege and imprison them.

4.  Spy on their movements wherever they are.

As for killing or fighting them anywhere, according to Ibn Kathir, the well-known opinion is that this verse is general and is specified by Allah's saying:

And do not fight them at al-Masjid al-Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then fight them. (al-Baqarah/2: 191)

As for taking them captive, it has been permitted in this verse, whereas in the previous surah it was not yet permitted, as in Allah's saying:

It is not for a prophet to have captives [of war] until he inflicts a massacre [upon Allah 's enemies] in the land. (al-Anfal/8: 67)

This verse is in accordance with the sahih hadith, including the Prophet's words:

I have been commanded to fight the people until they testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the messenger of Allah, and they establish prayer and pay zakat. (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from 'Abdullah bin Umar).

This verse is one of the four verses called "ayatul qital" meaning "verses of fighting," because these four verses were revealed to kill or fight with the use of weapons.

First: this verse is to kill or fight the polytheists.

Second: to fight the People of the Book, as mentioned in Allah's saying:

Fight those who do not believe in Allah or in the Last Day and who do not consider unlawful what Allah and His Messenger have made unlawful and who do not adopt the religion of truth from those who were given the Scripture - [fight] until they give the jizyah willingly while they are humbled. (at-Taubah/9: 29)

Third: is to fight the hypocrites, as mentioned in Allah's saying:

O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites. (At-Tahrim/66: 9)

Fourth: is to fight the *bugat* (those who cause unrest), as mentioned in Allah's saying:

And if two factions among the believers should fight, then make peace between them. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the ordinance of Allah. (al-hujurat/49: 9)

Among the scholars of tafsir, some are of the opinion that this verse is *naskh* (abrogated) by Allah's saying:

So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure their bonds, and either [grant] favor afterward or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. (Muhammad/47: 4)

Among the scholars, some are of the opposite opinion, namely that this verse abrogates verse 4 of Surah Muhammad, because this verse was revealed later. And there are also those who are of the opinion that this verse does not contradict verse 4 of Surah Muhammad and other verses, because all scholars agree on the obligation to eradicate disbelief and error, all of which do not have to be done through warfare but should be adjusted to other factors, such as ability and circumstances.

If the polytheists repent and return to the right path by believing in Allah and His Messenger, uttering the two *kalimah syahadat* (declaration of faith), performing *salat* (prayer) and paying *zakat* (obligatory charity), then they must be given broad freedom, not fought, not taken captive, not imprisoned, and not spied on anymore. As an outward testimony of faith, it must be by uttering the two *kalimah syahadat* after declaring conversion to Islam. And what is meant by *salat* here is the five daily *salat fardzu* (obligatory prayers) which are the pillars of Islam and show the obedience of faith that is required for every believer without distinction from any aspect, this *salat* cleanses the soul and improves morals:

Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing. (al-'Ankabut/29: 45)

And because *salat* has the power to establish a relationship between man and God.

And establish prayer for My remembrance. (thaha/20: 14)

Regarding *zakat* here, it is *zakat fardu* (obligatory charity) in Islam for those who have fulfilled its conditions, because this *zakat*, in addition to cleansing the soul of the person who gives *zakat* from unfavorable traits such as love of wealth and stinginess, is also very necessary for the poor and for the public interest. In short, polytheists should not be fought if they convert to Islam by fulfilling three conditions, namely:

1.  Believing in Allah and His Messenger by uttering the two *kalimah syahadat*.

2.  Performing the five daily *salat fardu*.

3.  Paying *zakat wajib* (obligatory charity) when its conditions have been met.

The words of the Messenger of Allah saw:

I have been commanded to fight the people until they testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, establish prayer and pay zakat, then if they do so, their blood and property are protected from me, except with the right of Islam and their reckoning is with Allah. (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from 'Abdullah bin 'Umar)

Based on the above description, some scholars are of the opinion that people who do not perform the five daily *salat* that are *difardzukan* (obligated) without an *udzur* (excuse) or reason permitted by sharia, and people who do not want to pay *zakat* that has met its conditions, then the law is that it is obligatory to kill them. While another opinion of the scholars says that it is not obligatory to kill them, only *ditazir* (disciplined) by the *imam* (ruler) by giving punishment of imprisonment and so on according to his consideration, and people who do not want to pay *zakat*, then the *imam* has the right to take their *zakat* by force.
text.6:
If someone from the polytheistic community asks Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) for protection, in order to listen to the words of Allah so that he can understand the essence of the Islamic da'wah conveyed by the Prophet, then the Prophet must protect him for a certain period. If he wants to believe, then he will be safe forever, and if not, then the Prophet is only commanded to escort him to the place he desires for his safety, after which the situation returns to its original state, which is like a state of war.

In this matter, the scholars of tafsir have differing opinions, including that the protection (security) given is only to the polytheists whose peace treaty with the Muslims has expired, and they have never violated it. And if the agreement is still valid, the Muslims are commanded to fulfill it as explained in verse four. Even polytheists whose four-month period given to them to decide their stance has expired, because the time is sufficient and does not need to be extended, this law of protection applies if they request it. However, some scholars are of the opinion that those who want to believe are still given an opportunity that lasts four months. However, according to the strongest opinion, this is left to the imam.

In this matter, Ibn Kathir is of the opinion that a disbeliever who comes from a *dar al-harb* (land of disbelief) to the Islamic region to carry out a task such as trade, request peace, request a cessation of hostilities, bring *jizyah* (tribute), and request security from them, is given protection as long as he is in the Islamic region until he returns to his country.
text.7:
Allah and His Messenger cannot continue and maintain the treaty with the polytheists except with those who uphold the treaty near the Masjid al-Haram. Therefore, as a general guideline that must be implemented by the Muslims towards the polytheists, it is explained that if they adhere to the terms of the treaty, then the Muslims should do likewise towards them. Allah loves those who are righteous, while those who do not heed the terms of the treaty are those who are treacherous and do not fear Allah SWT.

What is meant by the Masjid al-Haram treaty here is the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah, which occurred when the Prophet Muhammad SAW and a large number of his companions in the 6th year of Hijri departed from Medina towards Mecca to perform Umrah. After they arrived at a place called Hudaybiyyah, 13 miles west of the city of Mecca, they were intercepted and obstructed by the Quraish infidels, resulting in a peace treaty named after that place.

According to a narration by Ibn Abi Hatim, among the polytheistic Arab tribes who upheld the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah were the Bani Amrah tribe and the Kinanah tribe. Therefore, according to some commentators (mufassir), the Prophet and the Muslims completed the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah with these two tribes, even though the four-month period given to the polytheists had expired.
text.8: Among the reasons for the annulment of the treaty is when the polytheists gain victory over the Muslims, then they no longer care about kinship ties and the bonds of peace treaties. They are clever at attracting the sympathy of the Muslims with sweet words, even though their hearts do not match what they say. They do this because most of them are *fasik* who do not know the true creed and good morals, so they act according to and follow their desires. So, with the polytheists already so hateful towards the Prophet Muhammad (saw) and the Muslims, there is certainly no point in making agreements with them, whatever their form and shape. They have generally justified all means to achieve their goals. The end of this verse explains that most of them are *fasik*.
text.9: The polytheists exchanged the verses of Allah, which contain teachings of monotheism, faith, and others, for something of very low quality and value, so that they could continue to enjoy the worldly advantages they desired and to maintain the traditions, positions, power, and influence that brought them the worldly advantages they enjoyed. In essence, those advantages are very little compared to the advantages if they believed in the verses of Allah that bring eternal happiness in the Hereafter. But the polytheists did not care about any of that. Therefore, at the end of this verse, Allah explains that this act is very evil. Especially if all these actions are intended to hinder the spread of Islam.
text.10: Because of their disbelief, kinship ties and bonds of agreement vanished from their souls, so they did not hesitate to strike the believers in every way they could. They sought to seize every opportunity to destroy the Muslims, collectively or individually, openly or secretly, at every opportunity. Therefore, the end of this verse states that these various actions have truly transgressed all bounds.
text.11:
The polytheists who should be killed or fought, if they repent, meaning believe in Allah and His Messenger, perform the five daily prayers, and fulfill the obligation of zakat, then Allah declares that they are brothers in faith with the believers, having the same rights and obligations without any difference. Such a bond of brotherhood is a very strong and broad bond that can eliminate all kinds of disputes and hostilities caused by differences in tribe, nation, and so on. In this regard, the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

"I have been commanded to fight the people until they testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. If they testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, they face our qiblah, eat our slaughtered animals, and pray as we do, then their blood and their wealth are forbidden to us, except according to its right. They have the same rights and obligations as Muslims." (Narrated by Muslim from Anas bin Malik)

These verses are addressed to those who want to understand, especially regarding the polytheists who repent or do not, and how they should be treated.
text.12: When the polytheists violate the agreements they have made with the believers and they revile the Islamic religion, then Allah commands the Muslims to fight their leaders, because they do not keep their promise to stop hostility towards the Muslims and are unwilling to repent. The commentators (mufasir) explain that what is meant by reviling the Islamic religion is reviling the Prophet, the Qur'an, and so on, while what is meant by killing or fighting the leaders of the disbelievers here also includes their followers. Fighting the polytheists is permitted if they violate peace treaties and attack Islam and the Muslims.
text.13:
This verse encourages the spirit of the believers to earnestly carry out the command to fight the polytheists.

Allah mentions three main reasons that prove that the polytheists cannot be tolerated and left alone, namely:

1.  They violated the Treaty of Hudaybiyah, which they had agreed upon with the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) and his companions, to not engage in warfare for 10 years and to not disturb each other between the two parties and their allies. However, not long after, the Quraysh polytheists helped their allies from Bani Bakar to attack the Khuza'ah tribe, an ally of the Prophet, who lived in Mecca. Therefore, the Prophet felt obligated to defend the Muslims. Finally, on the 20th of Ramadan in the 8th year of Hijri, Mecca was liberated by the Muslims.

2.  Before the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) migrated to Medina, the polytheists had strived hard to expel the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) from Mecca, imprison him, or kill him by using the power of the Quraysh tribe so that the Prophet Muhammad's family would find it difficult to seek revenge. This is what is indicated by Allah's statement:

   "And (remember, [O Muhammad]), when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners." (al-Anfal/8: 30)

3.  They were the ones who started fighting the believers first in Badr, Uhud, Khandaq, and others.

After explaining these three main reasons, the spirit and attention of the believers are aroused so that they are not afraid to face the polytheists, because Allah is more worthy of being feared if they truly believe. Those who truly believe in Allah and His Messenger must dare to sacrifice for the sake of religion and truth without being shadowed by any doubt that causes fear and a decline in spirit, which is very detrimental to themselves.
text.14:
This verse commands the Muslims to fight the polytheists because they have broken their promises and fought against the Messenger and the Muslims. If they carry out this command, Allah will surely punish the polytheists with the strength of the believers. Allah will humiliate them, and Allah will help the believers to remove their sadness, who suffered due to the betrayal of the polytheists.

What is meant by Allah punishing the polytheists with the strength of the Muslims is killing and destroying them in battle. What makes them humiliated is their defeat, and they are made captives and slaves.

According to the narration of Ikrimah and other scholars, the believers whose sadness was removed were the Khuzaah tribe, while according to Ibn 'Abbas, it was the tribes of Yemen and Saba' who had converted to Islam and had suffered severe torment from the polytheists of Mecca. They sent messengers to complain about their suffering to the Messenger of Allah in Medina, and the Messenger of Allah conveyed greetings and good news to cheer them up, because Allah's help would come in the near future.
text.15:
The defeat of the polytheists would relieve the hearts and eliminate the sadness of the believers who had suffered much torment and persecution from the polytheists all this time, because they were unable to defend themselves in Mecca and unable to migrate to Medina or another safe place.

Furthermore, at the end of this verse, it is explained that Allah accepts the repentance of whomever He wills, and Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise. This verse indicates that many of the polytheists had repented and Allah had accepted their repentance. They became believers in Allah and His Messenger and staunch defenders of the Islamic religion. Allah is the One who manages His servants and manages the interests of the development of His religion in the future.
text.16:
This verse provides a very important warning to the Muslims to fight the polytheists. Allah also invites them to introspect and think consciously about the following:

a. Have they been truly carrying out jihad as they should?

b. Will the polytheists not fight them again and not violate agreements as they usually do?

c. Will the polytheists not revile the religion of Islam again and hinder people from embracing it, as they have done since the birth of Islam?

d. Have the Muslims forgotten the behavior of the hypocrites who stabbed the Prophet and the Muslims in the back?

e. Will the Muslims be left alone without trials and tests so that it is known who truly believes and strives in the way of Allah and does not take the polytheists as trusted friends, and who does the opposite?

The Muslims must be steadfast in facing all kinds of trials and tests, not be complacent with the results that have been achieved, and not be lazy or bored to continue the jihad. They must also know the obligation to protect themselves and be wary of all the enemy's deceptions, and not make them close friends. This has been warned many times in the Qur'an, including the word of Allah:

"O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves, for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would suffer. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. (Ali 'Imran /3: 118)"

Allah is All-Knowing of what the Muslims do in carrying out the command to strive and what is stored in their hearts, therefore they are commanded to obey the guidance and commands of Allah as best as possible.
text.17:
This verse explains that it is not fitting for the polytheists to maintain the Masjid al-Haram and other mosques. Maintaining the mosques of Allah is only done by making those places for the purpose of affirming the oneness and glorifying Allah, and obeying Him. This is only done by the believers. Maintaining a mosque means building it, managing it, and enlivening it with acts of worship that are pleasing to Allah. What is forbidden for non-Muslims is the control over the mosque, such as being its manager. However, using the labor of non-Muslims to build a mosque, such as employing construction workers and so on, is not forbidden. Likewise, Muslims are allowed to accept a mosque built by a non-Muslim or whose construction was bequeathed by a non-Muslim, or to repair it, as long as it does not contain a purpose that causes harm to the Muslims.

Although the commentators (mufassir) differ in opinion regarding the mosque referred to in this verse, whether it is only the Masjid al-Haram, in accordance with the revelation of this verse, as mentioned at the beginning of the commentary on this verse, and also in accordance with the reading of some scholars of qira'at who read it with *masjid* meaning the singular form, i.e., Masjid al-Haram, or whether it refers to all the mosques of Allah, in accordance with the plural form *masajid*. But all opinions, whether Masjid al-Haram or other mosques, it is not fitting and not permissible for the polytheists to maintain them.

Furthermore, in this verse, Allah explains that the deeds and works of the disbelievers that they boast about, namely maintaining the Masjid al-Haram, providing water for the pilgrims, and others, will be in vain as long as they are in polytheism (shirk). Allah says:

"If they had associated [others] with Allah, then worthless for them would have been what they were doing." (al-An'am/6: 88)

The end of this verse explains that the polytheists will abide eternally in Hellfire, because none of their deeds in the world are useful and can help them in the Hereafter.
text.18:
This verse explains that those who are worthy of maintaining the mosques of Allah are only those who truly believe in Allah and surrender to Him, believe in the coming of the Hereafter where all deeds will be recompensed, perform prayer (salat), pay zakat, and fear no one except Allah. These are the people who are expected to be among those who are guided to maintain His mosques. Many hadith explain the virtue of maintaining mosques, including the words of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him):

"Whoever builds a mosque for Allah, seeking His pleasure, Allah will build for him a house in Paradise." (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim, and at-Tirmidhi from 'Uthman bin Affan)

The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

"When you see a man habitually attending the mosque, then bear witness that he is a believer." (Narrated by Ahmad, at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Majah, and al-Hakim from Abi Said al-Khudri)

And his other saying:

"Indeed, there was a woman who used to sweep the mosque and then died. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) asked about her, and when he was told that the woman had died, the Messenger of Allah said, 'Why did you not inform me, so that I could pray for her? Show me where her grave is.' So the Messenger of Allah went to the grave and prayed over it." (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawud, and Ibn Majah)

In another hadith:

"Whoever lights a lamp in a mosque, the angels and the bearers of the Throne will constantly ask Allah to forgive his sins as long as the lamp shines in the mosque." (Narrated by Salim ar-Razi from Anas r.a.)
text.19:
The question contained in this verse is directed at the believers who disagree about which good deeds are more virtuous, as mentioned above. As an answer, it is explained that taking care of the Masjid al-Haram and providing drinks for those performing Hajj cannot be equated in virtue with believing in Allah and the Last Day and striving in the way of Allah. The deeds mentioned in the first part, although including good deeds, are not comparable in degree to the deeds mentioned later, namely faith and jihad in the way of Allah, as mentioned in this verse.

Considering these two types of deeds to be equal is an inappropriate assumption and contradicts the guidance of Allah, especially if it is considered that the first deed is more virtuous than the second.
text.20:
This verse explains that those who believe with a firm faith that motivates them to willingly migrate, leaving their homelands, wealth, and businesses, separating from their wives, children, parents, and relatives, are those who perform weighty deeds that require many sacrifices. Especially if these deeds are followed by jihad in the path of Allah, that is, by sacrificing their wealth and lives.

For those who do so, Allah will grant high recognition, as well as good fortune and happiness. As for the believers who do not migrate and do not engage in jihad in the path of Allah, even if they provide water for the pilgrims and maintain the Masjidil Haram, Allah's reward for them and the recompense given to them will not be as great as what is received by those who migrate and engage in jihad. Regarding a person's deeds that are not based on faith in Allah, those deeds will be in vain. Because the disbelievers will not receive any reward in the Hereafter.
text.21:
This verse explains that Allah gives good news to the believers who emigrate and strive in the path of Allah, that they will receive a vast reward of mercy, perfect pleasure, and Paradise which will be their eternal abode. The greatest reward is obtaining Allah's pleasure, as His word states:

Allah has promised the believing men and believing women gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever, and good residences in gardens of perpetual residence; but the greatest of all is Allah's good pleasure. That is the supreme success. (at-Taubah/9: 72)

This is also mentioned in a hadith of the Prophet Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him:

Allah says to the people of Paradise, "O people of Paradise." They reply, "We are obedient to You, our Lord." Allah says, "Are you all pleased?" They reply, "How could we not be pleased when You have bestowed upon us something that You have never bestowed upon anyone else?" Allah says again, "I will give you something even greater than what I have given." They ask, "O our Lord, what is that greater gift?" Allah says, "I have become pleased with you all and will never be angry with you after that, forever." (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim, at-Tirmidhi, and an-Nasa'i from Abi Said al-Khudri)
text.22: In this verse, Allah explains that those who obtain this favor will remain in Paradise forever. Indeed, with Allah is a great reward for those who believe and do righteous deeds, especially for those who believe, emigrate (hijrah), and strive (jihad) with their wealth and their lives.
text.23:
This verse was revealed in connection with the attitude of some Muslims when ordered to migrate to Medina. They replied, "If we migrate, our ties with our parents, children, and relatives will be severed, our trade will be ruined, and ultimately we will become worthless people."

This verse forbids believers from taking their parents and siblings who are still disbelievers as leaders, because it is feared that they will know the condition and strength of the Muslims. Such an act would be very beneficial for the disbelievers to attack the Muslims.

A believer who does not obey this prohibition and, in a state of war, still helps the disbelievers because of family ties, is a zalim (oppressor) against himself, his followers, and his religion.
text.24:
This verse provides a warning that if believers love their fathers, children, siblings, wives, families, wealth, businesses, and homes more than they love Allah and His Messenger, and striving to uphold His law, then Allah will bring punishment upon them sooner or later. Those who act in this way are the wicked who will not receive guidance from Allah SWT.

Here are some reasons why people love children, husbands, wives, mothers, fathers, families, and so on:

1.  That the love of children for their parents is an instinct that exists in every human being. Children, as descendants of their parents, inherit some of the characteristics and nature of their parents.

2.  That the love of parents for their children is also an instinct, even more profound, because children are the apple of their eye, expected to continue their lineage and carry on their life history. In this case, parents are willing to bear all kinds of sacrifices for the happiness of their children's future.

3.  That love for siblings and relatives is a common love in the context of carrying out life and helping each other, assisting each other, and defending each other in household life and social life. Such love will foster feelings of mutual respect and affection.

4.  That the love of husband and wife is an integrated love between two types of creatures who build offspring and build a household for the happiness of life in this world and the hereafter. Therefore, the integrity of a harmonious husband-wife relationship is essential for the harmony and happiness of life that is longed for.

5.  That love for wealth in all its forms, whether business assets, inheritance, trade, or houses and so on, is a love that has become human nature. All that is loved is an inseparable need for human life, which is pursued by taking all paths that Allah has permitted.

6.  Love of trade is a human instinct, because it is a source of wealth development.

7.  Love of residence, because the house is a place to live and rest every day.

As for love for Allah, it must be prioritized over all kinds of love mentioned above because He is the One who gives life and existence, with all kinds of His blessings to humans, and He is perfect and Holy from all shortcomings. Likewise, love for the Prophet Muhammad SAW must be given priority because the Prophet Muhammad SAW was sent by Allah SWT to bring guidance and be a mercy to the universe.

Allah says:

"Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love Allah , then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins." (Ali-'Imran/3: 31)

And the Prophet Muhammad SAW said:

"None of you truly believes until I am more beloved to him than his parents, his children and all of mankind." (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim from Anas)
text.25:
This verse explains that the believers received much help from Allah in the battles against the polytheists who hindered the spread of Islam. This help came in the form of complete victories, both sooner and later, such as the Battle of Badr, which resulted in a great victory, and the Battle of Hunain, which initially resulted in defeat but later in victory. In the Battle of Hunain, the number of Muslim soldiers was very large, while the number of disbelieving soldiers was smaller than the number of Muslim soldiers. With such a large number of soldiers, the Muslims felt proud and felt that they could not be defeated, but the reality was not so. The Muslims were pushed back by the disbelievers, as if the large number of soldiers, wealth, and complete war preparations were of no use whatsoever, so that the vast earth felt narrow and caused them to retreat and flee in a scattered state.

It is narrated by Ibn Majah, al-Baihaqi and others from Aktsam bin Aljan that the Battle of Hunain took place in the eighth year of the Hijri, after the liberation of Mecca, in a place called Hunain, a valley located between Mecca and Taif. The number of Muslim soldiers was 12,000, while the number of disbelieving soldiers was only 4,000. In this battle, the Muslims suffered defeat and were forced to retreat, but finally Allah's help came and the Muslims gained victory.

It is narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from al-Barra' bin 'Azib r.a. who described the atmosphere of the Battle of Hunain, namely: A man from Qais asked, "O Abu 'Imarah, did you also leave the Messenger of Allah in the Battle of Hunain?" Abu 'Imarah replied, "The Messenger of Allah did not flee even though the people of Hunain with their accurate archers, were able to launch their attacks, but we were still able to paralyze them. When the Muslims were competing for spoils of war, the enemy rained them with arrows, so the Muslims suffered defeat and the enemy gained victory. At that time I saw the Messenger of Allah saw. riding a horse appearing in front while saying bravely, "I am the Prophet, the son of Abdul Muthalib, do not hesitate, O Allah, send down Your help."
text.26:
This verse explains that after the Muslims felt sadness and grief due to the defeat in the Battle of Hunain, Allah sent down help to them in the form of steadfastness of heart and bringing unseen reinforcements. These reinforcements consisted of angels. The feelings of sadness and grief for the Muslims turned into calmness, courage, and enthusiasm to move forward. Finally, the disbelievers suffered defeat, were killed, taken prisoner, and their wealth became spoils of war. This defeat was a punishment for them and that is the recompense for their disbelief and the recompense for their hostility towards the Muslims.

Allah SWT says:

Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them. (at-Taubah/9: 14)
text.27: This verse explains that for those who have already received punishment from Allah in this world due to their disbelief, they can be granted forgiveness and their repentance accepted if they have received guidance from Allah to embrace Islam. If they have become Muslims and no longer associate partners with Allah, then their mistakes are forgiven by Allah and all their sins are erased, because Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
text.28:
After the Messenger of Allah (saw) appointed Abu Bakar as *amirul hajj*, the Messenger of Allah tasked Ali bin Abi Talib to accompany Abu Bakar in reciting the initial verses of Surah at-Taubah before the people. Anxiety arose among the Muslims, fearing food shortages because the polytheists were no longer allowed to enter Mecca to perform the hajj.

At the end of this verse, Allah guarantees the believers against poverty. They need not worry about a lack of food and merchandise due to Allah's prohibition against the polytheists, who usually came to the holy land bringing merchandise. Allah's guarantee to the believers for a good life depends on one's business activities and efforts. However, it is inseparable from the will of Allah, to whom Allah gives His grace. Therefore, believers should strengthen their faith and reliance (*tawakal*) on Allah while making efforts and striving. Allah knows the future, whether it concerns prosperity or poverty that befalls the inhabitants of a land. Allah is All-Wise in all matters, especially regarding His provisions, whether in the form of commands or prohibitions.

Allah has fulfilled His promise because, in reality, the people of Mecca did not experience hardship. After the prohibition was spread, more and more polytheists converted to Islam, not only those around the Arabian Peninsula but almost to all corners. They were certainly obligated to perform the hajj, and they were also free to visit the holy land. This was one way for the people of Mecca to obtain prosperity in life. With Allah's prohibition against polytheists entering Masjidilharam, differences of opinion arose among *fiqh* scholars as follows:

1. Polytheists and People of the Book are not allowed to enter Masjidilharam, while other mosques are allowed for the People of the Book. This is according to the *mazhab* of Imam Shafi'i.

2. Polytheists, including the People of the Book, are not allowed to enter any mosques. This is according to the *mazhab* of Maliki.

3. Only polytheists are prohibited from entering Masjidilharam (excluding the People of the Book). This is according to the *mazhab* of Hanafi.

4. Some scholars are of the opinion that polytheists are prohibited from entering the *tanah haram* (sacred land), and if they come secretly (disguised), then die and are buried, then after it is known, it is obligatory to dig up the grave and bury it outside the *tanah haram*.
text.29:
In essence, this verse is an initial step for Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to shift his attention to the Battle of Tabuk that he would face. The Battle of Tabuk was the last battle undertaken by Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) after the Muslims had conquered the city of Mecca. Tabuk is located north of Medina, bordering Jordan/Syria (Damascus), which at that time was controlled by the Roman Empire, which adhered to Christianity. When news reached Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that the Romans were preparing a large force to control the border area, Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) announced to all Muslims through the tribes to prepare to gather all their strength to join the Prophet in fighting the Roman forces. This call from Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was immediately welcomed by the Muslims who were strong in faith, except for the hypocrites who sought excuses, as had become their habit, especially in facing Tabuk, in addition to the great distance and the intense heat of the sun. After Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the Muslim forces arrived in Tabuk, they found that the Roman forces had already evacuated the Tabuk area to retreat back to the interior. Then the People of the Book who were there requested peace and submitted the *jizyah* to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a sign of their recognition to submit to Islamic rule, because they were not yet willing to embrace Islam.

Every war during the time of the Prophet was only for self-defense or to retaliate against attacks. In this verse, Allah commands the Muslims to fight the People of the Book because they possess four elements that cause them to be hostile to Islam. These four elements are:

1. They do not believe in Allah, because they have destroyed the foundation of monotheism. They make priests as holy people who have the right to determine something, both regarding regulations pertaining to worship and those related to halal and haram. Likewise, Christians consider Jesus the son of Allah, while Jews also consider Uzair as the son of Allah. This clearly shows that they all associate partners with Allah in making religious regulations.

2. They do not believe in the Hereafter, because they consider that life in the Hereafter is merely a spiritual life. The error of their assumption is because there is no clarity, either in the Torah or the Gospel, about the existence of the Day of Resurrection and retribution after death, when humans will rise again as they were originally created, consisting of body and soul, each of which will feel the pleasure of Allah's grace as affirmed in the Al-Qur'an.

3. They do not forbid what Allah and His Messenger have forbidden. The Jews do not forbid what Allah forbade in the law brought by Moses and which was partially *naskh* by Jesus, meaning that its law is no longer valid. They consider it permissible to eat wealth in an unlawful (batil) way, such as usury and so on, and they follow the ways of the polytheists in the ferocity of war and the treatment of prisoners. Meanwhile, Christians consider permissible what Allah forbade in the law of Moses that has not been *naskh* by the Gospel. In the Torah, Allah forbids the fat of meat or the price of its sale. Christians do not consider it haram.

4. They do not adhere to the true religion, which is the religion revealed to Moses and Jesus (peace be upon them). What they consider religion is actually a way made by their priests based on their thoughts and interests. The reason for this is that the Torah, which was revealed to Moses, and the Gospel, which was revealed to Prophet Jesus, were written long after they died. So the Torah and the Gospel were written based on the understanding of their followers. Even several centuries after the ascension of Jesus, they chose four Gospels that contradict each other. Such is their condition, as indicated by Allah's words:

(But) for their breaking of the covenant We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a good portion of that which they were reminded.
